channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic continues to spread as Australia turns its attention to outbreaks in Victoria.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global cases pass 9 million, Australian death toll stands at 104

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: The list of Australians becoming involved in the new North American competition continues to grow with two former Wallabies headed for California.
item.title: Giteau set to join Ashley-Cooper and Mitchell in USA's Major League Rugby

item.description: Zoe and I met at Christmas, and were so great together that I asked her to move in with me for the lockdown.
item.title: About Last Night: she’s reluctant to let me resume my old life

item.description: Racism needs to be front and centre in our social awareness.
item.title: Cath Moore: Is this really a watershed moment for us?

item.description: Author Leah Swann on the four books that changed her.
item.title: Author Leah Swann on the four books that changed her

item.description: In her debut memoir, Ashe Davenport captures the full gamut of motherhood.
item.title: Ashe Davenport's Sad Mum Lady isn't the story of every mum

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Critic's Choice M Magazine June 28
item.title: Critic's Choice M Magazine June 28

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Sometimes when celebrity guests arrive on the Play School set, they are overcome with a mix of nostalgia and stage fright.
item.title: People with games, and stories to tell: Play School's creative modernity

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Three different options for what to watch on Saturday, July 4.
item.title: Live drawing, chaos in LA, and puppy power: Saturday's picks

item.description: You don’t need to be obsessed with television to enjoy Quiz.
item.title: A quintessential scandal for the familiar and the fans

item.description: Milton Glaser designed an iconic Dylan poster with psychedelic hair and helped revive New York Magazine with his boundary-pushing imagery.
item.title: The man behind the 'I Love NY' logo, Milton Glaser, dies age 91

item.description: West Australians knocking back work because they're comfortable on JobSeeker are being urged to get off their backsides, with Premier Mark McGowan saying "our economy needs you".
item.title: 'WA needs you': McGowan calls on state's job seekers to get off their backside

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: The season-ending knee injury for Victor Radley a bitter blow for the premiers as the club faces an injury crisis.
item.title: Fittler says Radley loss a blow for both Roosters and NSW

item.description: A man has fallen off a sailing vessel in waters off central Queensland.
item.title: Air and sea search for boat crew member missing off Queensland coast

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Shane Mumford says he sees shades of a young Joel Selwood in the GWS Giants academy product, who starred in just his second AFL game on Friday night.
item.title: Selwood-esque: Veteran Giant's high praise for draftee Tom Green

item.description: The former foreign minister talks post-politics fashion and sneaker trends.
item.title: Julie Bishop on the fashion advice she took from Anna Wintour

item.description: Some 124 immigrant children in family detention with their parents are set to be released next month - but not the 1000 unaccompanied minors in other centres.
item.title: US judge orders immigrant children to be freed from detention

item.description: The block's draft in-and-out list reflects an assessment of how well other countries have managed to control their outbreaks.
item.title: Europe prepares to reopen to foreign travelers, including Australians

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: There have been 41 new cases of COVID-19 in Victoria in the last day, the state's deputy chief health officer has announced.
item.title: Victoria records 41 more cases of coronavirus

item.description: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk says an announcement about the opening of the Queensland border would be made on Tuesday after advice from the state's Chief Health Officer.
item.title: 'We don't want a second wave': Victorian spike weighs on Queensland border call

item.description: Follow all today's round four action live as the Saints, Tigers, Bombers and Blues take to the field
item.title: AFL 2020 Live Updates: Port Adelaide Power take on the West Coast Eagles

item.description: Even as the NBA was unveiling its schedule for the conclusion of the regular season, commissioner Adam Silver admitted that the league's "bubble" can't be made totally safe from the pandemic.
item.title: Sixteen COVID cases as NBA admits risks over Florida 'bubble'

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Collingwood will be without a vital cog in their line-up next week against Essendon as Jeremy Howe recovers from a significant knee injury however the defender is hopeful his season is not over
item.title: Howe hopeful his season is not over after knee injury

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Bankwest Stadium's playing surface is not considered a safety risk as the NRL shelves preliminary plans to shift weekend games to the Central Coast and Kogarah.
item.title: 'The surface is fine': NRL dismisses concerns about Bankwest Stadium

item.dc:creator: Chris Vedelago
item.description: Diners at a packed Moonee Ponds restaurant were none-the-wiser when shots were fired into the back of it and into a car nearby on Friday night.
item.title: Shots fired outside Moonee Ponds restaurant popular with gangland figures

item.description: The deal, for the first time, unites the two rival parties that have dominated Irish politics since independence a century ago, plus the Greens.
item.title: Irish civil war rivals and Greens to govern together in new coalition

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Australia's 2 million landlords will miss out on billions of dollars in rental income over the next two years as tenants struggle to pay, with housing market researchers suspecting many more property investors will claim a financial loss.
item.title: Landlords tipped to claim billions more in tax losses as homes sit vacant

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Scott Morrison said on Friday it was "not unreasonable" to assume international tourism will not resume until mid-2021.
item.title: Tourism industry braces for $55 billion hit with overseas travel likely banned until July 2021

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Melbourne Storm will temporarily set up camp on the Sunshine Coast, but they won't know more about Cameron Munster's knee injury until Sunday.
item.title: Storm secure Sunshine Coast base but wait on Munster injury

item.description: Council members wanted to seize on a groundswell of support for significant policing changes following George Floyd's death under the knee of a police officer.
item.title: Minneapolis council votes to dismantle police department

item.description: Animated TV comedy The Simpsons is ending the use of white actors to voice characters of colour, producers said on Friday.
item.title: The Simpsons ditches using white voices for characters of colour

item.description: Mark Zuckerberg says Facebook will now flag or ban content containing hate-speech or misinformation, including from President Donald Trump.
item.title: 'No exceptions': Facebook finally caves to pressure over Trump posts

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Ken Maumalo, David Fusitua and Agnatius Paasi are among the Warriors stars considering leaving the team to return to their young families.
item.title: NRL hold crisis talks with homesick Warriors as trio indicate desire to return to NZ

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Within the space of 72 hours, the two voices behind the Socceroos' finest moment announced they were leaving their jobs at Fox Sports and SBS.
item.title: Australian football's voice weakened by Hill, Foster exits

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Three people were also seriously injured in the accidents in Brisbane, Toowoomba, Nambour, Yeppoon and Cardwell.
item.title: Four die on roads in 24 hours in horrific start to Queensland holidays

item.description: Haunted by the killing of an Afghan farmer, an Australian army medic sought out his sons.
item.title: Age tablet interactive: 'I'm so sorry': An Australian soldier, an Afghan son and a death that can’t be forgotten

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Queensland's school holidays start with perfect weather but a few clouds and showers are forecast for Sunday amid a predicted wetter-than-average winter.
item.title: Holidays kick off with fine winter weather, but showers loom for Sunday

item.description: Administration was not authorised to use $3.64 billion in Pentagon money for part of the border wall, court rules, but long-term implications are unclear as Supreme Court earlier ruled in Trump's favour.
item.title: Trump's use of military funds for Mexican wall illegal, court rules

item.description: 10 times the size of the Royal National Park in far north-west NSW
item.title: NSW Parks lands biggest conservation purchase in state's history

item.description: An asylum seeker who was fed 'the same spaghetti and macaroni cheese' in extended lockdown stabbed six people, including a police officer.
item.title: Asylum seeker shot dead after stabbing spree was 'hungry' while in Glasgow hotel quarantine

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: The former Labor senator Sam Dastyari called for a royal commission or commission of inquiry to "get to the bottom of it".
item.title: 'Flabbergasted': Dastyari calls for judicial inquiry into foreign influence in politics

item.dc:creator: Aja Styles
item.description: West Australian egg producers are fearful for their futures given the push by supermarket giants Coles and Woolworths to ban caged eggs.
item.title: WA egg farmers will crack under supermarkets' cage-free demands, warns industry

item.dc:creator: Annie Brown
item.description: Some of the most interesting moments in fashion history have come after extreme disruptions, just look at the shimmering, liberated flappers of the 1920s.
item.title: Will we ever dress up again?

item.dc:creator: Nicole Precel
item.description: A Yarra Valley vineyard gutted by fire is reopening, just in time for school holiday-goers hoping to traverse Victoria despite looming COVID-19 case rises.
item.title: Yarra Valley winery gutted by fire set to reopen
